ai.summary: Forge Walk is a 10.6 km moderate hike in the UK, offering a mix of rural tracks, woodland paths, and open countryside.
ai.terrain_summary: The route combines well-defined tracks, grassy bridleways, and occasional gravel sections. Expect gentle elevation changes, possible muddy patches after rain, and scenic views across fields and wooded areas.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and daylight before setting out. Wear sturdy footwear with good grip and stay on marked paths. Bring a map or GPS and know your route. Carry enough water and snacks, plus a layered waterproof jacket for changing conditions. Be mindful of livestock on rural sections, leave no trace, and carry a small first aid kit and whistle. In low visibility, turn back if you’re unsure.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Layered clothing and a waterproof jacket
Map and/or GPS device (and optional compass)
Small first aid kit and personal medications
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn is ideal; the route is enjoyable in mild conditions, but it can be tackled year-round with appropriate gear.
